reviews.text: I stayed here for one night in October. I booked it on Priceline (name your own price - 3 star) and got it for $60 a night. Staff was nice, location is great and they supposedly have a no parties policy.
reviews.title: Great hotel and super convienent

reviews.text: The room was quiet and very nice - much larger than traditional rooms and had a full, small kitchen. I didn't use the kitchen, since I was only there one night, but it would have come in handy had I been staying there longer. They do have breakfast, but I slept through it (oops!) and a pool, which I didn't use because of the cooler weather. Would definitely stay here again - my first choice in Tyler.
reviews.title: Too expensive for what it offers

likes.liked: — Huge suite for 15$ more per night
likes.disliked: — Old and in need of rennovation

reviews.text: It just so happened that I had to visit 3 hotels from the same chain in the course of 1 month, and this ranks on the bottom of my list.
reviews.title: Decent but Noisy
Bad experience
reviews.text: Front desk is polite, no complaints there. I was given a suite which had a living room, kitchennette, dining room and a bathroom on 1st level and a bedroom and bathroom on a second level. Pretty big, but it was old and unsightly. This hotel really needs rennovation, and for $150 per night they should already have the money to do it.

reviews.title: Like staying in an apartment
reviews.text: Breakfast again is the worst I saw in all the other Residence Inns I visited recently - by "worst" i mean, the least choice offered.
